column5: Just got a MSG from Golden Eagle, Eggs are not allowed to cross the border that were purchased in the USA. He told me that if you arrive with eggs, you must go back across the border dispose of them and then get back in line.
What ? Well if our eggs aren't safe in Canada, they surely aren't safe here in the US ! Or is this just another one of those hair brained ideas they came up with ???
There safe in Canada!!you just can't crack'em open.
This is the 4th thread on this topic in the past month. One of them had 75 posts so it shouldn't be a surprise!
Same goes for the live chickens you are used to bringing up; flying-in ducks, geese, loons must line up at the border for a full body inspection before they are allowed to continue north. Bill

My wife told me last night that when she went into the post office yesterday, a postal employee was on the phone with a customer letting them know their shipment of chicks had arrived and needed to be picked up. The crate of chicks was sitting on the counter and they were just chirping away. I thought that was hilarious. PjShorthorn
Maybe it's Chickenpox and you will have to be vaccinated for that too?
Right!!!! Just buy your eggs in Canada or dont go or continue the complaining and bagging of their rules to enter their country.
